member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.BulkInsert.BulkInsertOperation._disposeOnce

member.name: P:Raven.Client.Documents.Conventions.DocumentConventions.SendApplicationIdentifier
member.summary: Enables sending a unique application identifier to the RavenDB Server that is used for Client API usage tracking. It allows RavenDB Server to issue performance hint notifications e.g. during robust topology update requests which could indicate Client API misuse impacting the overall performance

member.name: P:Raven.Client.Documents.Conventions.DocumentConventions.SecondBroadcastAttemptTimeout
member.summary:
Set the timeout for the second broadcast attempt. Default: 30 Seconds.
Upon failure of the first attempt the request executor will resend the command to all nodes simultaneously.

member.name: P:Raven.Client.Documents.Conventions.DocumentConventions.FirstBroadcastAttemptTimeout
member.summary:
Set the timeout for the first broadcast attempt. Default: 5 Seconds.
First attempt will send a single request to a selected node.

member.name: P:Raven.Client.Documents.Conventions.DocumentConventions.ThrowIfQueryPageSizeIsNotSet
member.summary: If set to 'true' then it will throw an exception when any query is performed (in session) without explicit page size set. This can be useful for development purposes to pinpoint all the possible performance bottlenecks since from 4.0 there is no limitation for number of results returned from server.

Default value: null means that the priority of the index is Normal.

member.name: T:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.FieldIndexing
member.summary: Options for indexing a field

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.FieldIndexing.No
member.summary: Do not index the field value. This field can thus not be searched, but one can still access its contents provided it is stored.

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.FieldIndexing.Search
member.summary: Index the tokens produced by running the field's value through an Analyzer. This is useful for common text.

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.FieldIndexing.Exact
member.summary: Index the field's value without using an Analyzer, so it can be searched. As no analyzer is used the value will be stored as a single term. This is useful for unique Ids like product numbers.

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.FieldIndexing.Default
member.summary: Index this field using the default internal analyzer: LowerCaseKeywordAnalyzer

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.AutoFieldIndexing.No
member.summary: Do not index the field value. This field can thus not be searched, but one can still access its contents provided it is stored.

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.AutoFieldIndexing.Search
member.summary: Index the tokens produced by running the field's value through an Analyzer. This is useful for common text.

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.AutoFieldIndexing.Exact
member.summary: Index the field's value without using an Analyzer, so it can be searched. As no analyzer is used the value will be stored as a single term. This is useful for unique Ids like product numbers.

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.AutoFieldIndexing.Highlighting
member.summary: Index the tokens produced by running the field's value through an Analyzer (same as Search), store them in index and track term vector positions and offsets. This is mandatory when highlighting is used.

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.AutoFieldIndexing.Default
member.summary: Index this field using the default internal analyzer: LowerCaseKeywordAnalyzer

member.name: T:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.FieldStorage
member.summary: Specifies whether and how a field should be stored.

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.FieldStorage.Yes
member.summary: Store the original field value in the index. This is useful for short texts like a document's title which should be displayed with the results. The value is stored in its original form, i.e. no analyzer is used before it is stored.

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.FieldStorage.No
member.summary: Do not store the field value in the index.

member.name: T:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.FieldTermVector
member.summary: Specifies whether to include term vectors for a field

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.FieldTermVector.No
member.summary: Do not store term vectors

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.FieldTermVector.Yes
member.summary: Store the term vectors of each document. A term vector is a list of the document's terms and their number of occurrences in that document.

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.FieldTermVector.WithPositions
member.summary: Store the term vector + token position information

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.FieldTermVector.WithOffsets
member.summary: Store the term vector + Token offset information

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Indexes.FieldTermVector.WithPositionsAndOffsets
member.summary: Store the term vector + Token position and offset information

member.summary: The document did not exist, but patchIfMissing was specified and new document was created

member.summary: The document was properly patched

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Operations.PatchStatus.Skipped
member.summary: The document was not patched, because skipPatchIfChangeVectorMismatch was set and the etag did not match

member.summary: Neither document body not metadata was changed during patch operation

member.name: P:Raven.Client.Documents.Operations.PatchResult.Status
member.summary:
Result of patch operation:
- DocumentDoesNotExists - document does not exists, operation was a no-op,
- Patched - document was properly patched,
- Created - document did not exist, but patchIfMissing was specified and new document was created,
- Skipped - document was not patched, because skipPatchIfChangeVectorMismatch was set and the etag did not match,
- NotModified - neither document body not metadata was changed during patch operation

member.name: M:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.DocumentSubscriptions.GetSubscriptionWorker(Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionWorkerOptions,System.String)
member.summary: It opens a subscription and starts pulling documents since a last processed document for that subscription. The connection options determine client and server cooperation rules like document batch sizes or a timeout in a matter of which a client needs to acknowledge that batch has been processed. The acknowledgment is sent after all documents are processed by subscription's handlers. There can be only a single client that is connected to a subscription.
member.returns: Subscription object that allows to add/remove subscription handlers.

member.name: M:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.DocumentSubscriptions.GetSubscriptionWorker(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: It opens a subscription and starts pulling documents since a last processed document for that subscription. Although this overload does not an SubscriptionConnectionOptions object as a parameter, it uses it's default values. The connection options determine client and server cooperation rules like document batch sizes or a timeout in a matter of which a client needs to acknowledge that batch has been processed. The acknowledgment is sent after all documents are processed by subscription's handlers. There can be only a single client that is connected to a subscription.
member.returns: Subscription object that allows to add/remove subscription handlers.

member.name: M:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.DocumentSubscriptions.GetSubscriptionWorker``1(Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionWorkerOptions,System.String)

The connection options determine client and server cooperation rules like document batch sizes or a timeout in a matter of which a client needs to acknowledge that batch has been processed. member.returns: Subscription object that allows to add/remove subscription handlers.

member.summary: Represents a single item in a subscription batch results. This class should be used only inside the subscription's Run delegate, using it outside this scope might cause unexpected behavior.

member.name: T:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionOpeningStrategy
member.summary: Options for opening a subscription

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionOpeningStrategy.OpenIfFree
member.summary: The client will successfully open a subscription only if there isn't any other currently connected client. Otherwise it will end up with SubscriptionInUseException.

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionOpeningStrategy.TakeOver
member.summary:
The connecting client will successfully open a subscription even if there is another active subscription's consumer. If the new client takes over an existing client then the existing one will get a SubscriptionInUseException.
The subscription will always be held by the last connected client.

member.name: F:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionOpeningStrategy.WaitForFree
member.summary: If the client currently cannot open the subscription because it is used by another client but it will wait for that client to complete and keep attempting to gain the subscription

member.name: E:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionWorker`1.AfterAcknowledgment
member.summary: allows the user to define stuff that happens after the confirm was received from the server (this way we know we won't get those documents again)

member.name: T:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionWorkerOptions
member.summary: Holds subscription connection properties, control both how client and server side behaves

member.name: M:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionWorkerOptions.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a subscription connection
member.param: Subscription name as received from CreateSubscription

member.name: P:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionWorkerOptions.SubscriptionName
member.summary: Subscription name as received from CreateSubscription

member.name: P:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionWorkerOptions.TimeToWaitBeforeConnectionRetry
member.summary: Cooldown time between connection retry. Default: 5 seconds

member.name: P:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionWorkerOptions.IgnoreSubscriberErrors
member.summary: Whether subscriber error should halt the subscription processing or not. Default: false

member.name: P:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionWorkerOptions.Strategy
member.summary: How connection attempt handle existing\incoming connection. Default: OpenIfFree

member.name: P:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionWorkerOptions.MaxDocsPerBatch
member.summary: Max amount that the server will try to retrieve and send to client. Default: 4096

member.name: P:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionWorkerOptions.MaxErroneousPeriod
member.summary: Maximum amount of time during which a subscription connection may be in erroneous state. Default: 5 minutes

member.name: P:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionWorkerOptions.CloseWhenNoDocsLeft
member.summary: Will continue the subscription work until the server have no more new documents to send. That's a useful practice for ad-hoc, one-time, persistent data processing.

member.name: P:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionWorkerOptions.SendBufferSizeInBytes
member.summary: Send buffer size for the underlying connection. Default: 32768 bytes (32 kB)

member.name: P:Raven.Client.Documents.Subscriptions.SubscriptionWorkerOptions.ReceiveBufferSizeInBytes
member.summary: Receive buffer for the underlying connection. Default: 4096 bytes (4 kB)

member.name: T:Raven.Client.Json.Serialization.NewtonsoftJson.Internal.Converters.DateTools
member.summary:
Provides support for converting dates to strings and vice-versa. The strings are structured so that lexicographic sorting orders them by date, which makes them suitable for use as field values and search terms.
This class also helps you to limit the resolution of your dates. Do not save dates with a finer resolution than you really need, as then RangeQuery and PrefixQuery will require more memory and become slower.
Compared to {@link DateField} the strings generated by the methods in this class take slightly more space, unless your selected resolution is set to Resolution.DAY or lower.
Another approach is {@link NumericUtils}, which provides a sortable binary representation (prefix encoded) of numeric values, which date/time are. For indexing a {@link Date} or {@link Calendar}, just get the Unix timestamp as long using {@link Date#getTime} or {@link Calendar#getTimeInMillis} and index this as a numeric value with {@link NumericField} and use {@link NumericRangeQuery} to query it.

member.returns: a string in format yyyyMMddHHmmssSSS or shorter, depending on resolution; using GMT as timezone

member.name: P:Raven.Client.ServerWide.Tcp.TcpNegotiateParameters.ReadResponseAndGetVersionCallback
member.summary:
ReadResponseAndGetVersion Function should take care reading the TcpConnectionHeaderResponse respond from the input 'stream' And return the version of the supported TCP protocol.
If the respond is 'Drop' the function should throw. If the respond is 'None' the function should throw. If the respond is 'TcpMismatch' the function should return the read version.

member.name: T:Raven.Client.Util.RateLimiting.RateGate
member.summary: http://www.jackleitch.net/2010/10/better-rate-limiting-with-dot-net/ Used to control the rate of some occurrence per unit of time.

remarks.para: To control the rate of an action using a , code should simply call prior to performing the action. will block the current thread until the action is allowed based on the rate limit.
This class is thread safe. A single instance may be used to control the rate of an occurrence across multiple threads.
